page.title: 03Fishing in Flookburgh
page.content: Fishing at{Flookburgh}is unique. Fishing is carried out on{Morecambe {Bay}using a tractor and trailer..fifty years ago they used horses and carts and many people were involved.Now only twelve families work in this way. Teena often goes with her Dad and Grandad on fishing trips, leaving in the early morning, before school. They go down to their shed, Teena checks the fuel,while Dad sorts out the trailer with its nets and gear. Then they drive out of the village on to the marshes that lead to the vast expanse of Morecambe Bay.They discard the waste of yesterdays catch which soon attract scavenging waders and gulls. From here they drive onto the sands and mudflats.Great care must be taken as the{gullies,channels}and{quicksands have claimed tractors and fishermen.
